intro: Lasianthus capitatus subsp. capitatus, commonly known as the purple-flowered ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, showy purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. It is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
